evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The date on which a patient receives the first administration of any component of the study treatment (CT-P16/EU-Approved Avastin, paclitaxel, or carboplatin).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Study drug administration will be started on the same day as randomization.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP provides a precise operational definition consistent with the Protocol and Original SAP.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as the last non-missing observation... recorded prior to the First Dose Date.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The baseline value for all analyses will be the last non-missing value prior to the first infusion unless otherwise specified.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Calculated as (Last Dose Date – First Dose Date) + 1.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Time on the study drug... calculated as (Last dose date – First dose date + 1)

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as a patient achieving a Best Overall Response (BOR) of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) as assessed at the end of Cycle 6
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: patients with controlled disease (complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD), assessed at the end of Cycle 6)
evaluation_table.protocol_text: patients with controlled disease (complete response [CR], partial response [PR], or stable disease [SD], assessed at the end of Cycle 6)

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Calculated as the integer part of (Date of Informed Consent – Date of Birth) / 365.25. [GAP: If only year of birth is collected...]
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Age will be automatically calculated in the eCRF system based on the informed consent signed date, the year of birth and information on whether the date of birth has passed or not.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP implies calculation from Year of Birth. Generated SAP provides standard formula but correctly identifies the potential GAP if full DOB is not collected. This is a robust handling of the definition.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Time from the first documented response (CR or PR) until the first documentation of PD or death
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: time between initial response (CR or PR) that is confirmed by the subsequent assessment... and PD/recurrence or death from any cause
evaluation_table.protocol_text: time between initial response (CR or PR) and PD/recurrence
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP correctly includes 'death' in Section 6.2.2, aligning with the Original SAP's explicit update to the Protocol (Section 12). However, see internal contradictions.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as the period from Study Day 1 through the day before the first dose of monotherapy in the Maintenance Study Period, or until the EOT visit
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP operationalizes the cycle-based definition into specific dates for analysis windowing. This is consistent with the study design.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as the period from the First Visit Date (ICF signature) to the day before the First Dose Date.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Screening evaluations will be completed within 28 days prior to randomization.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Screening evaluations will be completed within 28 days prior to randomization.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP defines the analysis period (ICF to First Dose) which is standard for ADaM, whereas Protocol defines the eligibility window (28 days pre-randomization). These are compatible.

additions.generated_sap_text: The date on which the patient signed the informed consent form (ICF).
additions.reasoning: Standard definition for analysis start point.

additions.generated_sap_text: The date of the last administration of any component of the study treatment
Defined as the period beginning the day after the EOT visit until the date of death, withdrawal of consent, or the end of the study

missing_definitions.original_sap_text: any event not present before exposure to study drug or any event already present that worsens in either severity or frequency after exposure to study drug
missing_definitions.protocol_text: any event not present before exposure to study drug or any event already present that worsens in either severity or frequency after exposure to study drug
missing_definitions.reasoning: Missing from Key Definitions section (4.2), though likely present in Safety section. As a key analysis variable, it is often included in Key Definitions.

missing_definitions.original_sap_text: Prior: start and stop dates are before the date of first infusion. Concomitant: stop date that is on or after the date of first infusion or missing.
missing_definitions.reasoning: Missing from Key Definitions section (4.2), but standardly placed in specific Concomitant Medication sections.

internal_contradictions.text_a: the time between initial response (CR or PR) and PD/recurrence
internal_contradictions.text_b: Time from the first documented response (CR or PR) until the first documentation of PD or death
internal_contradictions.description: Section 2.2.1 omits 'death', contradicting Section 6.2.2 and the Original SAP's explicit update to the Protocol.

issues.source_text: Response duration... defined as the time between the initial response... and PD/recurrence or death from any cause (Original SAP Section 12)
issues.generated_text: Response duration: the time between initial response (CR or PR) and PD/recurrence (Generated SAP Section 2.2.1)
issues.description: The Generated SAP lists the old Protocol definition in Section 2.2.1, ignoring the Original SAP's update which added 'death'. However, Section 6.2.2 correctly includes 'death'.
issues.reasoning: Inconsistent definitions within the Generated SAP.

reasoning: The Generated SAP includes a dedicated 'Key Definitions' section (4.2) that excellently operationalizes temporal variables (Dates, Periods, Durations) which were only implied or scattered in the Original SAP. This is a strong improvement. The definition of 'Age' includes a GAP note acknowledging potential data limitations, which is very good. However, there is an internal contradiction regarding 'Response Duration' where one section uses the old Protocol definition and another uses the updated Original SAP definition. Additionally, key safety definitions (TEAE) are missing from this specific section, though likely present elsewhere.
summary: The Key Definitions section is well-structured and accurately operationalizes study timelines. A minor internal contradiction exists regarding the definition of Response Duration across different sections.
